alert.note: Alert for Northern Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Piscataquis County through 400 PM EDT... At 315 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Churchill Dam to near Chesuncook. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chesuncook, Chamberlain Lake, South Branch Pond, Tamway, Churchill Dam, Telos Lake and Baxter State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.
